result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle J. Sconzert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kyle J. Sconzert is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kyle J. Sconzert was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Kyle J. Sconzert was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Expunction request is denied on the battery & theft charge.  Court may consider expunction on the bail jumping charge.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Pay DNA surcharges.   
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. 
Review hearing 8-14-15 @ 9:00 am.  Probation & Parole to provide written report by 8-12-15.  DOC shall promptly notify the Court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.  
***  Except for purposes of employment, deft shall be confined to his residence between 10 pm - 6 am unless permission obtained by agent.

supervisions.notes: COSTS ROLLED INTO SENTENCE ON CT. 1
PROBATION REVOKED  -  COMMENCE FORTHWITH  -  HUBER ALLOWED IF WORKING

PROBATION REVOKED   
DUE 30 DAYS AFTER RELEASE FROM KCJ OR 14 DAYS WORK CREW OR 14 DAYS KCJ CONSECUTIVE.

Minutes:  15CM284/15CM380.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Greg Bates.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments made.

15CM284 - Ct 1- deft sentenced to 9mos KCJ.  Credit for 76 days.  Huber allowed if working.  Unpaid costs rolled on count 1 rolled into jail sentence.  Ct 3 - deft fined $200 plus costs.  Due 30 days after release from his jail sentences.  In default, 14 days work crew or 14 days KCJ consec.

15CM380 - deft sentenced to 9mos KCJ consec to 15CM284.  Huber allowed if working.  Unpaid costs rolled into sentence

Appeal rights.
Atty Greg Bates
DOC's Revocation Summary and Statement

Screen 77 (CACU-I77C) w/copy of Revocation Order and Warrant; filed by Dept of Corr/Probation&Parole.   Defendant revoked on 6-24-15; to be returned to court for sentencing.  ZERO PAID ON PROBATION - ALL COSTS STILL DUE.

After reviewing the court record regarding the expunction request - Court requested the clerk to check the court reporter.  Per court reporter - expunction request was denied on the battery & theft charges.  However, the court did note for the record that he would consider expunction on the bail jumping charge if deft successfully completed probation.  Per Court - if deft successfully completes his probation term, the BJ shall be expunged.
Voluntary Appearance: March 9, 2015
Emailed information from Judge via clerk that bond remains forfeited after review of request for bond return to poster.
Emailed correspondence regarding copy of trial transcripts

Minutes:  14CM1895/15CM284/15CM380.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Matt Perz.  Cases are resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  

14CM1895 - dismissed on State's motion per plea agreement

15CM284 - deft pleads guilty to counts 1 & 3; found guilty by the Court.  Remaining count dismissed on State's motion.

15CM380 - deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Remaining count dismissed on State's motion.

Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for 2yrs on each count concurrent.  RH set for 8/14/15 @ 9am.  Expunction request is denied on the battery & theft charges.  Court may consider expunction on the bail jumping charge.
Cash bond to be left as is until next hearing.
